content.description: A somewhat contrived, but decent route.  Very thin crack, to fingers, to 2 bolts.  The first bolt is unnecessary and tries to draw you on to the face.  Much better climb if you just follow the line of weakness (i.e., the cracks to the left of the bolt).
content.protection: Gear to 2", and 2 bolts.  Has anchors for toproping, but use the Dangerous Dan anchors for rapping.

content.description: Very thin crack to bolted face.  Lots of face moves, using crack primarily for gear.
content.protection: Gear to 0.5", 1 bolt.  #00 (grey), #0 (purple), and #1 (blue) TCU's useful.  Chain anchors.
content.location: On a pillar, ~15 feet left of main (cave) area.  Look for obvious thin crack with 1 bolt above it.

content.description: Insecure vertical climbing. The crux is moving up from flaring pod to next jam. PG13 as gear is finicky and difficult to place from insecure stances for the the first 20'.
content.protection: Gear to 2". Offset cams useful for flaring pod. Bolted anchor at top.
content.location: Crack to the right of Earth Girls are Easy

content.description: Climb out left side of small cave, to bulge, to face.  Mostly gear, with one bolt in the upper section.  Slightly awkward but good climbing.  One of the longer routes here.
content.protection: Gear to 3", one bolt, chain anchors.
content.location: Just left of small cave in the main area.  Shares upper section with "Jamolator" (.12b/c), a bolted route that comes out the right side of the cave.

content.description: The new North Tahoe guidebook states that the route "tackles the short buttress with the triangular roof", but it also doesn't provide a pic of the route. This may or may not be the same route. I found pulling over the roof to be closer to 5.10+ and somewhat height dependent, YMMV. Watch for loose rock.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor, looked newish as of summer 2017

content.description: Crack in left-facing corner.  Follow corner for ~40 feet, then head right to bolt-protected face moves.
content.protection: Gear to 2", one bolt, two bolt anchor (bolts & hangers only, no chains). Can lower off the chain anchor of "Earth Girls are Easy" to the left.
content.location: Route is directly above the top of the approach trail.  Look for a slightly-inverted, left-facing corner, with a bulgy, rounded arete to the right.  Rap off chains.

content.description: Climb the dirty, shaded gully to chain anchors at the top. The route follows the right side of the gully where pro placements seem to be more abundant compared to the left. Lots of good holds and has a very alpine feel due to the bits of broken rock through. Mossy cracks are more common here (may need to be cleaned), as this route stays shaded much of the time.
content.location:
Head 40 ft. to the right of "Don't Skate Mate" and walk around the corner. The gully is obvious and in the corner, chain anchors are visible.

**Note: "Don't Skate Mate" is not listed in mountain project. Once at the top of the approach trail (this is Left Wall), turn right and walk along the trail until you turn left around an obvious corner, the gully will be in the corner**

content.description:
On the left side of the crag this is the corner just to the right of Garden Party.

Iron Jerks
Slightly wide crack, just left of "Nipples That Cut Glass".  Shares anchors with "Tahoe Bolt Murder" and "Club Toe" (.11c).  Not the best route, but not the worst either.
content.location: ~5 feet left of small cave in main area, has a wide-ish upper section.

content.description:
Near the left end of the crags climb the corner just left of Iron Jerks.

Garden Party
Thin double cracks, to hanging flake, to hands.  Flake is slightly hollow, be careful if placing gear behind it.  Easiest to finish at "Made Of Silk" anchors (to the right).
content.location: Straight ahead from top of approach trail; ~10 feet left of "Made Of Silk".  Look for "hanging tooth" feature at ~20 feet high.

content.description: Pinched-off dihedral to bolt ~25 feet off ground, back to gear, finish with another bolt up high and slightly left.  Gear before first bolt is small and a little funky.
content.location: Start ~30' right of the small cave in the main area.

content.description: One of the better offerings at Twin Crags.  A little heads up on lead, as the crux is ~25 feet off the ground, with only a couple small pieces in.  Sustained 5.10 climbing the whole way.
content.protection: Gear to 2", rap rings at anchors.  I protected the crux with a purple TCU and a #4 BD stopper.
content.location: Midway between the cave and the right end of the crag; just right of a 4 bolt 5.12.

content.description:
Climb the second corner left of Iron Jerks.

Cornered

Climb the crack immediately to the right of the column at the bottom of "By Fair Means." Once at the roof, work your way around to the right. Continue up the water streaked cracks above to chain anchors. The crux lies just before the route's one bolt, where the holds become more sloper-ish for a few moves.
content.protection: Single rack to 3", 1 bolt, chain anchors
content.location: Start is immediately to the right of "By Fair Means," in the crack to the right of the column.

content.description: Follow a crack up the broken corner immediately to the right of Flirting with Disaster.
Crack just to the right of "Jamolator", a bolted 5.12.  Pull a small roof ~25 feet up, head slightly left to anchors shared with "Jamolator" and "Nipples That Cut Glass".
content.location: First obvious crack to the right of the small cave in the main area.

content.description: Fingers and hands crack.  Crux is pretty low, ~20' off the ground.  Continue up to upper chain anchors (not to rap rings for Slam Dunk, the bolted .12 to the right).
content.location: Last obvious crack at the right side of the main wall, just left of a line of bolts.  In front of the large ponderosa pine.
